intro: Ditaxis lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ditaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
